p: Among these significant factors contributing to the human infection risk, elevation, temperature and precipitation indices have been found to be important drivers of SFTS infection in the past studies [ 27]; Strong correlations have been found in Henan Province of central China between SFTS risk and suitable environments for ticks, including grass and shrub cover, as well as forested land fragmented by agricultural or shrub cover [ 49]. Non-irrigated agricultural land cover has also been found to be associated with SFTS incidence in Hubei province in China [ 50]. These findings corroborated the important role of these factors by independent studies.
